title: [bug] On `dev`, `window.__TAURI__.invoke` not defined but used in examples

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

On `dev` branch, the Tauri examples use `window.__TAURI__.invoke`:

https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/c6c59cf2373258b626b00a26f4de4331765dd487/examples/commands/index.html#L18-L19

However, these examples fail with:

```
[Error] TypeError: window.__TAURI__
          .invoke is not a function. (In 'window.__TAURI__
          .invoke(commandName, args)', 'window.__TAURI__
          .invoke' is undefined)
```

`window.__TAURI__` is defined (`withGlobalTauri` is `true`), but it has no function named `invoke`.

### Reproduction

On `dev` branch:

```
cargo run --example commands
```

Click on any button.

Other examples, such as `streaming`, have the same issue.

### Expected behavior

`window.__TAURI__.invoke` should be defined, or the examples should be updated if needed.

### Platform and versions

```text
[✔] Environment
    - OS: Fedora 38.0.0 X64
    ✔ webkit2gtk-4.1: 2.42.1
    ✔ rsvg2: 2.56.3
    ✔ rustc: 1.73.0 (cc66ad468 2023-10-03)
    ✔ Cargo: 1.73.0 (9c4383fb5 2023-08-26)
    ✔ rustup: 1.26.0 (5af9b9484 2023-04-05)
    ✔ Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu (environment override by RUSTUP_TOOLCHAIN)
    - node: 18.18.0
    - pnpm: 8.8.0
    - yarn: 1.22.19
    - npm: 9.8.1

[-] Packages
    - tauri [RUST]: 2.0.0-alpha.10
    - tauri-build [RUST]: 2.0.0-alpha.6
    - wry [RUST]: 0.30.0
    - tao [RUST]: 0.21.0
    - @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: not installed!
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 2.0.0-alpha.16

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: default-src 'self'
    - distDir: ["../index.html"]
    - devPath: ["../index.html"]
```


### Stack trace

_No response_
